title: Retro Denim & Jeans History
description: From workwear to fashion statement, how well do you know the story of blue jeans through the decades?

questions.question: Which iconic Levi's jean style, featuring a button fly and straight leg, is the oldest continuously produced jean in the world?
questions.explanation: The Levi's 501, originally produced in 1890, is the original riveted blue jean and the oldest continuously produced jean style in the world.

questions.question: What film star's appearance in jeans and a white T-shirt in 'Rebel Without a Cause' (1955) made denim a symbol of youth rebellion?
questions.explanation: James Dean's iconic look of jeans, white T-shirt, and red jacket in 'Rebel Without a Cause' made blue jeans the uniform of teenage rebellion.

questions.question: What were jeans originally called before the term 'jeans' became standard?
questions.explanation: Levi's originally called their riveted denim pants 'waist overalls.' The term 'jeans' didn't become the standard name until the 1950s.

questions.question: In the 1950s, some schools banned students from wearing jeans because they were associated with what?
questions.explanation: Many 1950s schools banned blue jeans because they were associated with juvenile delinquency, partly due to their appearance in movies about rebellious youth.

questions.question: What popular jeans style, featuring a flared leg from the knee down, dominated 1970s fashion?
questions.explanation: Bell-bottom jeans, with their dramatic flare from the knee down, were the definitive jeans style of the 1970s, often worn with platform shoes.

questions.question: Which jeans brand, founded in 1947 and known for its 'W' back pocket stitching, was originally designed for cowboys?
questions.explanation: Wrangler was launched in 1947 specifically targeting the cowboy and rodeo market, becoming the official jeans of the Professional Rodeo Cowboys Association.

questions.question: What special wash treatment, using pumice stones to soften new denim, became popular in the early 1980s?
questions.explanation: Stone-washed jeans, created by tumbling denim with pumice stones to give a worn, faded look, became hugely popular in the early 1980s.

questions.question: What 1980s denim treatment created random bleached patterns on jeans using chlorine and pumice?
questions.explanation: Acid-washed jeans, created by soaking pumice stones in chlorine and tumbling them with denim, were a defining 1980s fashion trend.

questions.question: What did teenage girls in the 1970s commonly do to make their jeans fit as tightly as possible?
options: Wear them wet in the bathtub
questions.explanation: A common 1970s trick was to put on jeans, sit in a bathtub of hot water, then let them dry on your body so they would shrink to a skin-tight fit.

questions.question: Which Lee jeans style, designed specifically for women with a higher waist and slimmer fit, was introduced in the 1950s?
questions.explanation: Lee Riders were originally designed as cowboy jeans but became popular with women in the 1950s and 1960s. Lee later made women-specific styles in response to demand.

questions.question: What decorative technique did hippies use to customize their jeans in the late 1960s and early 1970s?
questions.explanation: Hippies embroidered flowers, peace signs, and colorful designs on their jeans, and applied patches over holes, making each pair a unique work of art.

questions.question: What denim item, cut from jeans just above the knee, became essential summer wear in the 1970s?
questions.explanation: Cut-off denim shorts (also called Daisy Dukes after the 1979 TV character) became a summer staple, made by simply cutting the legs off old jeans.

questions.question: What was the 'designer jeans war' of the late 1970s and early 1980s?
options: A trade dispute over denim imports
A rivalry between Levi's and Wrangler
Competition between high-fashion brands putting their names on jeans
A legal battle over denim patents
questions.explanation: The designer jeans war saw brands like Calvin Klein, Gloria Vanderbilt, Jordache, and Sassoon competing fiercely to put their names on premium denim.

questions.question: What did the small pocket inside the right front pocket of jeans originally hold?
questions.explanation: The small 'watch pocket' inside the front right pocket of jeans was originally designed by Levi's in the 1800s to hold a pocket watch.

questions.question: Which 1980s jeans brand used the advertising tagline 'Ooh la la, Sassoon!' in its TV commercials?
questions.explanation: Sasson jeans ran memorable TV commercials in the early 1980s with the catchy 'Ooh la la, Sasson!' jingle that became part of pop culture.
